intro: Acmadenia macropetala, commonly known as the large-petaled acmadenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are known for their fragrant scent, attracting various pollinators. Acmadenia macropetala is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and inland environments.
